reasoning: Silent myocardial ischemia is a subtype of myocardial ischemia typically detected via electrocardiography or imaging in asymptomatic patients. Incidence estimated at ~45 per 100k person-years based on epidemiological studies and cardiac surveillance data. Data from multiple observational cohorts suggests this accounts for significant proportion of undiagnosed cardiac ischemia.
source: Framingham Heart Study and follow-up epidemiological literature on silent ischemia detection
